thread.title_full: The week in comics: Stan Lee and William Shatner tease a mystery project - Jessica Jones News - Comics - Digital Spy

author: Hugh Armitage
title: The week in comics: Stan Lee and William Shatner tease a mystery project - Jessica Jones Comics -
text: Take a seat and check out our rundown of all the biggest comics stories from the past seven days, from getting Luke Cage and Iron Fist together again to the nerdgasm that will unite Stan Lee and William Shatner.Get a free first peak at the world of Jessica Jones © Marvel Comics / Netflix Netlfix and Marvel have got together to give us a first taste of their upcoming Jessica Jones series on comiXology and Marvel.com.The sometime superhero's creators Brian Michael Bendis and Michael Gaydos got back together for the short digital comic, and this is our first proper look at the new show's setup, so tuck in.Stan Lee and William Shatner tease the ultimate geek teamupNerd gods Stan Lee and William Shatner are teasing a project. We have no idea what, but Deadline says all will be revealed at Lee's Comikaze Expo in Los Angeles on October 30 to November 1.Whatever this might be, how can it not be at least a little bit amazing?Luke Cage and Iron Fist - back together again © Marvel Comics Marvel's street level pals Luke Cage and Danny Rand are getting back together in David Walker and Sanford Greene's Power Man and Iron Fist (via Fast Company).The cynics in us would point out their imminent arrival in Netflix's shows, but the art is looking strange and sweet so we'll just settle for excitement.Stop waiting for the Locke & Key films © IDW Publishing After years of wrangling, it looks like Joe Hill and Gabriel Rodriguez's brilliant horror series Locke & Key isn't coming to film after all.On the plus side, Hill told Broke Horror Fan another stab at a television series could happen. The first, you'll remember, never made it past the pilot, though the little we got to see looked fairly excellent.Rachael Smith has a new webcomic coming © Rachael Smith We love Rachael Smith's work (especially Flimsy), and now Broken Frontier has a first look at her new webcomic, Bess.Not much to go on yet, and Smith says, "The only things I can say for sure about Bess right now is that it's about feminism and ideals of beauty, involves Japanese mythological creatures, and is mainly set in a supermarket in Hull…"Colour us intrigued.From the ELCAF filesThe East London Comic Arts Festival is delving into its archives to bring a series of videos from its previous events.The first is the 2014 event with the fantastic Canadian cartoonist Seth. Look, it's there, just above. Check it out.Fight Club is back againHot on the heels of the well-received Fight Club 2 comic, novelist Chuck Palahniuk is apparently planning a second return to the world of Tyler Durden in a one-shot.The writer spilled the beans to Chris Thompson on the Orbital in Conversation podcast (well-spotted by The Beat).Jimmy Palmiotti and Justin Gray are back with AbbadonLong-time collaborators Jimmy Palmiotti and Justin Gray (Jonah Hex, Power Girl) have a new project at Adaptive Books.Abbadon (not a misspelling, we promise) takes the pair back to their favourite place - the Wild West - for a tale of crime, murder and all the things they love the best. It's out on October 20.
